pros: Great Professors to work with and they will help you and provide the resources you need when you need.
cons: I really don't have cons I can think off. It is school after all

pros: Great school, great traditions, overall wonderful students. Most professors and staff are welcoming, supportive, and working in the trenches with you. Great opportunity to meet some amazing people. Good state employee benefits.
cons: Senior leadership is disconnected, insulated, and continues to give themselves big raises but fail to keep the employees even close to appropriate pay scales. If you are competent or outwork your peers, you will be boxed in and not promoted. If you enthusiastically take on the mission and work to implement the leadership's goals, you will not be promoted - but your peers who are not as effective will. And again, pay is not commiserate with the work required or excessive hours required during the week and weekends. Forget seeing your family.

review_title: A good place if you don't mind the culture
job_title: Director of Events in Charleston, SC
pros: Flexible schedule, good benefits, and a beautiful campus.
cons: Not a place for anyone more liberal or who does not want to engage in the military industrial complex. It can be difficult to manage that brand if you don't believe in it.

review_title: A great opportunity to learn and expand your knowledge
pros: The Citadel’s greatest feature is by far the employees. Everyone is so welcoming and willing to help you succeed in your role. There are ample opportunities to learn about business functions and higher education in this setting.
cons:
Pay for parking
Outdated technology

pros: vacation and health insurance are pretty nice as is the summer work schedule. the students/cadets, most of them, are respectful and you can see how your work makes a difference. physical office environment is nice and bosses let you work from home with out too much red tape. you are provided the technology to do your job. good professional development opportunities.
cons: senior leaders are insulated, condescending and enjoy giving each other raises and bonuses while not providing for others. some areas are well run but other areas seem to be in disarray lately which doesn't instill confidence. president is nice but other vps are can be unapproachable. very old way of thinking - very white male perspective dominated. doesn't seem to have a handle on diversity.

pros: To work with great students.
cons: Limited opportunity for career growth.

job_title: Career Education Coordinator in Charleston, SC
pros: Great place to work, beautiful campus, great students, staff and faculty are friendly and always willing to help and collaborate
cons: Stuck back in time a bit, need to move forward quicker

pros: History, tradition, legacy, reputation, location
cons: Dated, conflicted, bureaucratic, lack of concern re: student experience. Identity crisis as an institution.

review_title: Not enough pay for amount of work
pros:
Co-workers are super nice
If not temporary you get full benefits
cons:
No PTO for temp employees
Ask you to do more work than you are paid 
Not paid enough to live in Charleston

review_title: Tradition is tradition, but this institution is stuck in a bygone era
pros: The campus is nice and Charleston is beautiful.
cons: Stagnant environment. Benefits and salaries aren't competitive. Work-life balance isn't championed whatsoever. For an institution that touts honor duty and respect, middle leadership leaves a lot to be desired.

pros: It's not a bad place to work. Kinda fun
cons: It's just very hot working in the laundry the dryer temp gets hot in building

job_title: Facilities Director of Finance in Charleston, SC
pros:
Work life balance
Pay isn't bad
cons: Poor upper management as senior vp level

job_title: Security Specialist III in The Citadel, SC
pros: Very good food to eat
cons: The boss is awesome to me

pros:
Engaging with students and professors
Reputable institution
Exposure to military culture
Work life balance
cons:
Very large workloads for small teams
Not a lot of room for advancement

job_title: Assistant Strength Coach in Charleston, SC
pros: Had a great experience there overall
cons: not enough pay to keep me there with cost of living in Charleston

job_title: Career Education Coordinator in Charlotte, NC
pros: Great students. Opportunity to collaborate on campus.
cons: Policies and procedures that have been in place for decades are hard to break down. Leadership and administration get all the raises, but claim there are none for anyone else on campus

job_title: Facilities and Engineering in Charleston, SC
pros: PTO is the best part of the job.
cons: Management is difficult to work with at times.

review_title: Low pay, extraordinarily long/strange hours. Work Most weekends.
pros: Free gym, food, working with other Vets
cons: Long Hours, overnights, weird hours, terrible compensation, extremely limited upward mobility, only two raises possible in entirety of career.

pros: I do not know anything
cons: It paid me pretty well.

pros: Working with the evening, day undergraduate and graduate students as well as the cadets. This school now has a large population of civilian students so it is no longer just a "military" school.  The student population is diverse and rapidly expanding to offer more opportunities to the low country.  The online degree offerings from the Citadel continue to grow and many other students across the United States are now joining the citadel team. The growth and expansion of the diverse student body at the citadel is a great thing for the state.
cons: The pay at the highest echelons is very out of balance compared to the rest of the employees. When full professors make $60K-$70K a year and the president and several others make obscene amounts, there is a problem. Just recently the top 7 or 8 employees at the school took huge pay increases and tried to cover it up when they were questioned about it.  From my standpoint, the leadership at the Citadel lacks ethics.

pros: As a writing tutor, The Citadel is a great place to work.  The pay is decent (for grad students, not for cadets), and the hours are pretty good.  The management of the Writing and Learning Center is awesome.
cons: As a cadet writing tutor, the pay isn't very good at all.  Plus, with the budget cuts affecting every institution of higher learning in South Carolina, the WLC budget was greatly impacted.  As a result, my tutoring hours were cut in half, removing the tutoring job as a sufficient source of income.

review_title: There is a Citadel family amongst the workers, some supervisors are better than others but that is everywhere.
pros: Benefits are great. Managers seem to care about the cadets and have high standards within the department. There is a true Citadel family where you genuinely help each other. Overall good place to work.
cons: Promotions are hard to come by as there are only so many that transfer, move or retire. Politics are an issue, but aren't they everywhere? Top heavy management-wise.

review_title: Structure and academics come together in an ideal way.
pros: Working with students is rewarding and fulfilling. The school has also just upgraded a significant amount of its facilities, which makes it much nicer than it used to be. The work schedule is pretty flexible and coincides with student breaks. high standards are upheld throughout the school and the cadets bring a sense of respect and duty into the departments.
cons: Being that most people here are paid via state funds and are government workers, promotions and advancement can sometimes be hard to come by.

pros: There truly is a Citadel family among the employees.  To have the impact, both directly and indirectly with the students that will hopefully make positive changes to the world is nothing short of a blessing. The respect of others and high standards on all levels at the college is above and beyond the norm.
cons: When I was at the college, the pay scale was substandard.  I understand implementation over the next 3 years will correct that - good news!

review_title: Mix nuts, some good some bad
pros: Some of your coworkers are great guys to work with and the work is not hard
cons: Supervisors are mostly incompetent, half your coworkers are slackers and the pay is average or below with no change to move up.

job_title: Student Coordinator I in Charleston, SC
pros: Get to work with cadets. They are better than average college students.
cons: School notoriously underpants its staff workers and part time employees while the upper echelon of administration enjoy better than average pay and benefits.

pros: If you like structure and the military environment, it's for you. Working for a state agency has more job security than other industries; 2 weeks off in December.
cons: Salaries not always competitive or comparable for the work done; lots of burearcy in making decisions; lack of career advancement

review_title: An excellent school offering a unique education in leadership development.
pros: The Citadel is great at promoting non-classroom education — you will be learning constantly as a cadet.
cons: The Citadel does struggle a bit with teaching innovation — this is an important skill for leaders to develop, but sometimes, as a military school, The Citadel gets trapped in old ways of thinking and doing things.

job_title: Director of Special Events in Charleston, SC
pros: The Citadel was a great place to work.   I would recommend it to anyone looking to surround themselves with a great community.
cons: I have nothing negative to say about my experience.

pros: Creative freedom and able to work on tasks independently. Given challenges and many opportunities for personal and professional growth. Working with an amazing team!
cons: No opportunity for full-time employment right now. State funding and budget constraints make things difficult.

pros: The student instructor program here is very beneficial to the students and the instructors alike.
cons: The pay is on the lower end, but it is a part time job helping out the university.

review_title: Great place to work, limited promotional opportunities
pros: Great people, benefits, and mission educating principled leaders.
cons: Limited promotional opportunities, particularly for non-military staff.

pros: I just heard the Registrar is retiring soon
cons:
Traditional school (dated policies and procedures) 
Military school (staff are expected to do as their told- don't ask questions. Which makes the working environment far from collaborative).
The turn over rate is mind boggling-please inquire about department turnover before accepting a position

pros: The jobs and students are easy to do/get along with.
cons: The work atmosphere is hostile and administration is abhorrent.

review_title: I like to work for the citadel
pros: People are so friendly. Good environment.
cons: Management is poor. They do not have enough experience.

pros: Faculty, Staff and Students are a pleasure to work with every day.
cons: Pay Scale cannot compete with corporate world.

job_title: Director of Network Operations and Security in Charleston, SC
pros: Very professional.  Great people.  Excellent school
cons: Parking can be a problem.  They are working on it.

review_title: Some grads feel entitled but others are great.
pros: The intentions are good. Some great employees.
cons: Daily grind. To focused on making money than doing what is right.

pros: People, Cadets, History, Location, Etc
cons: Parking, Traffic, Flooding sometimes, flow of information sometimes,

job_title: Training and Development Manager in Ladson, SC
pros: The Citadel has a great culture for work.
cons: Budget restricted due to campus size

pros: Great place to work, great atmosphere
cons: None to be honest its really a nice place to work

pros: Great hours, great staff, great campus,
cons: The summers off were the only thing that could be considered a con

pros: flexibility with time off or going to an appointment
cons: low pay, long hours. Much upward mobility.

pros: Flexible work and excellent management
cons: Not enough challenge unless you seek it- which you should

job_title: Head Coach in The Citadel, SC
pros: Good organization with a support from admin.
cons: Coaching an athletic team is a very uncertain profession.

pros: Great enthusiastic College and students
cons: High cost of living in Charleston

job_title: Assistant Director of Business and Compliance in Charleston, SC
pros: Consistent schedule throughout the year
cons: Not much changes around here

review_title: Truly a learning experience, but not in a good way
pros: I no longer work there
cons: Doesn't appreciate or compensate their employees.
